summary: Elizabeth L. Berning was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1979. These documents detail her presence on the committee's staff, indicating her role in the HSCA's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents list her name, position, salary, and pay period earnings, confirming her employment and compensation during the specified periods.
significance: Elizabeth L. Berning's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, contributing to the administrative and operational functions of the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role isn't detailed, her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates her involvement in the committee's activities.
